bugs.title: CVE-2023-5539 moodle: Authenticated remote code execution risk in Lesson [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5539 moodle: Authenticated remote code execution risk in Lesson [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5539 moodle: Authenticated remote code execution risk in Lesson

long_desc.thetext: A remote code execution risk was identified in the Lesson activity. By default this was only available to teachers and managers. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16, 3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451580

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2244897]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2244896]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2243352

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2243352,2244896

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update

bugs.title: CVE-2023-5541 moodle: XSS risk when using CSV grade import method [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5541 moodle: XSS risk when using CSV grade import method [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5541 moodle: XSS risk when using CSV grade import method

long_desc.thetext: The CSV grade import method contained an XSS risk for users importing the spreadsheet, if it contained unsafe content. The suggested workaround was to verify the contents and trustworthiness of grade spreadsheets before importing them. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16, 3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451582

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5542 moodle: Students can view other users in "Only see own membership" groups [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5542 moodle: Students can view other users in "Only see own membership" groups

bugs.title: CVE-2023-5543 moodle: Duplicating a BigBlueButton activity assigns the same meeting ID [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5543 moodle: Duplicating a BigBlueButton activity assigns the same meeting ID [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5543 moodle: Duplicating a BigBlueButton activity assigns the same meeting ID

long_desc.thetext: When duplicating a BigBlueButton activity, the original meeting ID was also duplicated instead of using a new ID for the new activity. This could provide unintended access to the original meeting. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5 and 4.0 to 4.0.10.
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451584

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5544 moodle: Stored XSS and potential IDOR risk in Wiki comments [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5544 moodle: Stored XSS and potential IDOR risk in Wiki comments

long_desc.thetext: Wiki comments required additional sanitizing and access restrictions to prevent a stored XSS risk and potential IDOR risk. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16, 3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5545 moodle: Auto-populated H5P author name causes a potential information leak [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5545 moodle: Auto-populated H5P author name causes a potential information leak

long_desc.thetext: H5P metadata automatically populated the author with the user's username, which could be sensitive information. The flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16, 3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-5548 moodle: Cache poisoning risk with endpoint revision numbers [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5548 moodle: Cache poisoning risk with endpoint revision numbers [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5548 moodle: Cache poisoning risk with endpoint revision numbers

long_desc.thetext: Stronger revision number limitations were required on file serving endpoints to improve cache poisoning protection. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16, 3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451589

bugs.title: CVE-2023-5549 moodle: Insufficient capability checks when updating the parent of a course category [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5549 moodle: Insufficient capability checks when updating the parent of a course category [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5549 moodle: Insufficient capability checks when updating the parent of a course category

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient web service capability checks made it possible to move categories a user had permission to manage, to a parent category they did not have the capability to manage. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16,
3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451590

bugs.title: CVE-2023-5550 moodle: RCE due to LFI risk in some misconfigured shared hosting environments [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5550 moodle: RCE due to LFI risk in some misconfigured shared hosting environments [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5550 moodle: RCE due to LFI risk in some misconfigured shared hosting environments

long_desc.thetext: In a shared hosting environment that has been misconfigured to allow access to other users' content, a Moodle user who also has direct access to the web server outside of the Moodle webroot could utilise a local file include to achieve remote code execution. This flaw affects versions 4.2 to 4.2.2, 4.1 to 4.1.5, 4.0 to 4.0.10, 3.11 to 3.11.16, 3.9 to 3.9.23 and earlier unsupported versions.
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451591
